content.question: In regard to eighteenth-century common practice counterpoint rules, which of the following notes best completes the bass part at the point indicated by the arrow?

choices.label: Quarter note D4 notated in bass clef.
Quarter note B-flat 3 notated in bass clef.
Quarter note E3 notated in bass clef.
Quarter note G2 notated in bass clef.

content.answer: Quarter note B-flat 3 notated in bass clef.

unit.text: 4: Harmony and Voice Leading I - Chord Function, Cadence, and Phrase

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Use symbols and terms to describe and apply harmonic, melodic, and rhythmic procedures of 18th-century voice leading (up to 4 voices) in notated music.
